text: Daydream is the fifth album by American singer and songwriter Mariah Carey. It was released on October 3, 1995 by Columbia Records. Musically, Daydream features Carey's signature R&B; and pop ballads, along with some uptempo dance songs along with the inclusion of hip hop; a genre, that Carey would include throughout her career. ==Track listing== ==Charts and certifications== ===Charts=== Chart Peak position Argentine Albums Chart 7 Australian Albums Chart 1 Austrian Albums Chart 5 Belgian Flanders Albums Chart 6 Belgian Wallonia Albums Chart 3 Canadian Albums Chart 2 Danish Albums Chart 2 Dutch Albums Chart 1 European Albums Chart 2 Finnish Albums Chart 12 French Albums Chart 2 German Albums Chart 1 Hungarian Albums Chart 13 Irish Albums Chart 6 Italian Albums Chart 6 Japanese Albums Chart 1 New Zealand Albums Chart 1 Norwegian Albums Chart 3 Portuguese Albums Chart 1 Spanish Albums Chart 5 Swedish Albums Chart 6 Swiss Albums Chart 1 UK Albums Chart 1 U.S. Billboard 200 1 U.S. Billboard R&B;/Hip- Hop Albums 1 ===End of year charts=== End of year chart (1995) Position Australian Albums Chart 9 Belgian Albums Chart (Flanders) 40 Belgian Albums Chart (Wallonia) 38 Canadian Albums Chart 84 French Albums Chart 17 End of year chart (1996) Position Australian Albums Chart 9 Canadian Albums Chart 12 French Albums Chart 20 U.S. Billboard 200 2 ===End of decade charts=== Chart (1990–1999) Position U.S. Billboard 200 18 ===Certifications=== Country (Provider) Certification (sales thresholds) Australia (ARIA) 5× Platinum Austria (IFPI) Gold Canada (CRIA) 7× Platinum Europe (IFPI) 3× Platinum France (SNEP) 2× Platinum Germany (IFPI) Platinum Japan (RIAJ) Million Netherlands (NVPI) Platinum New Zealand (RIANZ) 5× Platinum Norway (IFPI) Platinum Poland (ZPAV) Gold Spain (PROMUSICAE) 2× Platinum Switzerland (IFPI) Gold United Kingdom (BPI) 2× Platinum United States (RIAA) Diamond ===Singles=== Year Single Peak chart positions Certifications (sales thresholds) US US R&B;
